message.content:
cs.CV, cs.MM, cs.LG, cs.GR, cs.SD 

The paper deals with computer vision and machine learning techniques to estimate the location of the puck in hockey games from broadcast videos. Therefore, the most likely category is cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition). The paper also uses a 3D CNN-based architecture, which falls under the category of cs.MM (Multimedia). The paper also discusses the use of existing hockey event data, which involves data mining and machine learning techniques, making cs.LG (Machine Learning) another likely category. The paper also discusses the challenges of handling occlusions and changing camera angles, which falls under the category of cs.GR (Graphics). Finally, the paper discusses the accuracy of the method, which involves statistical analysis, making cs.SD (Statistics and Data Analysis) another possible category.
